description: <= [ Build by ART3MIS.CLOUD with LOVE ‚ù§Ô∏è ] => Complete Grafana Dashboard for GGXChain. Applicable to all Subrtrate base with minimum configuration changes.

panels.description:
Provide basic overview on blocks flow for ALL connected instances.

If required can add specific job as: substrate_block_height{job="my_job"}
panels.title: Chain Flow In Blocks

panels.description: Our instance mission. Display if node is validator or just passive observe.
panels.title: Nodes missions

panels.description:
Overview on grandpa roudns progression for ALL connected instances.

If required can add specific job as: substrate_finality_grandpa_round{job="my_job"}
panels.title: Grandpa Finality Round

panels.description:
Chain flow stability overview, can provide some ideas on general lag in consensus.

If required can add specific job as: 
increase(substrate_block_height{job="my_job"}[5m])
panels.title: Block Flow [ all ]

panels.description:
Grandpa rounds progression overview.

Add job if required as:
increase(substrate_finality_grandpa_round{job="my_job"}[1m])
panels.title: Grandpa Round Flow Control [ 1m ]

panels.description: Our instance mission. Display if node is validator or just passive observe.
panels.title: ! NODE MISSION !

panels.description: Number of seconds between the UNIX epoch and the moment the process started.
panels.title: process start time

panels.description:
Given the inherent dynamism of network behaviors, it is reasonable to anticipate fluctuating values over time. Consequently, it is advisable to align temporal parameters with the approximate intervals of block processing. The calibration of alerting thresholds demands a deliberate manual intervention to achieve optimal sensitivity. The visual representation provided here serves as a generic illustrative instance, showcasing the potential instantiation of alerts.

In the event of specificity being requisite, it is plausible to incorporate a distinct job, exemplified as: substrate_block_height{job="my_job"}
panels.title: Chain Flow => [ Alert Example ] <=

panels.description:
Given the inherent dynamism of network behaviors, it is reasonable to anticipate fluctuating values over time. Consequently, it is advisable to align temporal parameters with the approximate intervals of grandpa rounds length. The calibration of alerting thresholds demands a deliberate manual intervention to achieve optimal sensitivity. The visual representation provided here serves as a generic illustrative instance, showcasing the potential instantiation of alerts.

In the event of specificity being requisite, it is plausible to incorporate a distinct job, exemplified as: substrate_finality_grandpa_round{job="my_job"}
panels.title: Grandpa Rounds Flow => [ Alert Example ] <=

panels.description:
If value fall below dashed line, we are not validator anymore. This should be considered as maximum severity level as much as fatal.

Alerts doesn't support variables, target required instance manualy. Example: instance="my_ec2_instance",job="my_validator"
panels.title: Validation [ Alert ]

title: GGX Chain Grafana Dashboard
